abstract: The luxury brand's new infotainment system, appearing in the XTS full-size sedan next year, adapts touch- and speech-based technologies popularized by smartphone makers.
snippet: The luxury brand's new infotainment system, appearing in the XTS full-size sedan next year, adapts touch- and speech-based technologies popularized by smartphone makers.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Cadillac Division of General Motors Corp

lead_paragraph: Screen-swiping, pinching to contract, tapping an icon - these actions, popularized on smartphones, have become so ingrained in our mobile society's muscle memory that Cadillac has decided to build its new infotainment system around them.

headline.main: Cadillac's Cue: Tap, Drag, Scroll, Speak (and Drive, Too)
